2 #Logic Logic

2.1 #Logic.Variables Variables

Variables are a way of storing small pieces of code to reuse in your stylesheet. Changing the variable's code value will update it everywhere the variable is used.

Source: screen.scss, line 8

2.1.1 #Logic.Variables.animation-duration Animation Duration

Controls how long animations play for.

2.1.2 #Logic.Variables.animation-easing Animation Easing

Controls how animations accelerate and decelerate. The easing terms communicate how elements on the page relate to each other.

Source: logic/_variables.animation-easing.scss, line 1

2.1.2.1 #Logic.Variables.animation-easing.animation-easing-character animation-easing-character

The main focus of the animated element.

Source: logic/_variables.animation-easing.scss, line 9

2.1.2.2 #Logic.Variables.animation-easing.animation-easing-dialogue animation-easing-dialogue

Sub-items the character may be animating.

Source: logic/_variables.animation-easing.scss, line 19

2.1.2.3 #Logic.Variables.animation-easing.animation-easing-background animation-easing-background

The background which a character is placed on. Can also apply to background elements and layout.

Source: logic/_variables.animation-easing.scss, line 29

2.2 #Logic.Maps Maps

Maps are collections of related values contained in a variable.

Source: screen.scss, line 27

2.2.1 #Logic.Maps.breakpoints breakpoints

Organizes the site breakpoints. Breakpoints are declared with pixel values to work with the Mappy Breakpoints mixin.

Source: logic/_maps.breakpoints.scss, line 1

2.2.2 #Logic.Maps.colors colors

Organizes the site's palette. Color values should be managed on a per-component-basis, to keep color values from being misused.

Source: logic/_maps.colors.scss, line 1

2.2.3 #Logic.Maps.z-index z-index

Organizes the stacking order for items assigned a z-index value.

Source: logic/_maps.z-index.scss, line 1

2.3 #Logic.Functions Functions

Functions allow you to use conditional logic for your CSS values.

Source: screen.scss, line 39

2.3.1 #Logic.Functions.c c

Calls a color value from the colors map. Used to create a terse, yet managed system of color declarations.

Parameters:
  • $color-name
    The name of the color value you want to use. See TODO: link this
  • $color-variant
    Optionally calls a sub-color. Used for colors organized by component.
Source: logic/_functions.c.scss, line 1

2.3.2 #Logic.Functions.em em

Generates an em value from a pixel measurement, derived from the base type size.

Parameters:
  • $pixels
    The desired pixel value.
  • $context
    The font size to derive the em value from. Defaults to $base-type-size.
Source: logic/_functions.em.scss, line 1

2.3.3 #Logic.Functions.modular-scale ms

Generates a size value from a modular scale. Defaults to the base type size and ratio.

Parameters:
  • $increment
    The number to multiply the modular scale by.
  • $base-size
    The base type size to multiply the modular scale by. Defaults to $base-type-size.
  • $ratio
    The number used to construct the modular scale. Defaults to $type-scale.
Source: logic/_functions.modular-scale.scss, line 1

2.3.4 #Logic.Functions.rem rem

Generates a rem value from a pixel measurement, derived from the base type size.

Parameters:
  • $pixels
    The desired pixel value.
  • $context
    The font size to derive the em value from. Defaults to $base-type-size.
Source: logic/_functions.rem.scss, line 1

2.3.5 #Logic.Functions.strip-unit strip-unit

Removes the unit from a measurement, transforming it into a number.

Parameters:
  • $number
    The measurement value that will have its unit stripped. Must include a valid CSS unit.
Source: logic/_functions.strip-unit.scss, line 1

2.3.6 #Logic.Functions.z z

Calls a z-index value from the z-index map. Used to create a terse, yet managed system of z-index declarations.

Parameters:
  • $index
    The name of the z-index value you want to use. See TODO: link this
Source: logic/_functions.z.scss, line 1

2.4 #Logic.Mixins Mixins

Mixins let you repeat groups of CSS declarations across your stylesheet. They also let you use conditional logic to adjust what is declared.

Source: screen.scss, line 55

2.4.1 #Logic.Mixins.clearfix clearfix

Applies a clearfix hack.

Parameters:
  • $add-or-remove
    Accepts either add or remove as an argument.
Source: logic/_mixins.clearfix.scss, line 1

2.4.2 #Logic.Mixins.hide hide

Applies a clearfix hack.

Parameters:
  • $how
    Specifies which kind of technique used to hide content. Accepts visually, invisible, hidden, or remove as an argument. Defaults to visually.
Source: logic/_mixins.hide.scss, line 1

2.4.3 #Logic.Mixins.preserve-list-semantics preserve-list-semantics

Ensures that VoiceOver will declare the presence of list items, even if the list bullet has been removed. Apply to the ul, ol, dl element.

Source: logic/_mixins.preserve-list-semantics.scss, line 1

2.4.4 #Logic.Mixins.remove-margin-padding remove-margin-padding

Removes the margin and padding values on a component, but leaves other declarations intact.

Source: logic/_mixins.remove-margin-padding.scss, line 1

2.4.5 #Logic.Mixins.responsify responsify

Creates a basic full-width responsive element whose aspect ratio scales proportionately.

Source: logic/_mixins.responsify.scss, line 1
